column4: It works in Puppy, doesn't work at all in Xubuntu64 (guess it's the 32bit driver for the usb wifi adapter) and it works so far but doesn't connect in XUbuntu32.
Can try to disable security, but as I said, it works in Puppy on the same system, using ndiswrapper
I have the same problem same ra chipset but I can connect uding if config it just dhclient thats screw for me it may be the same for you
good to know that others got the same prob...
